Name: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to post a link on its website to allow for registration to become a bone marrow donor.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to post a link on its website to allow for registration to become a bone marrow donor

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to post a link on its website to the National Marrow Donor program, through which individuals can register to be a bone marrow donor. If New York State creates a state bone marrow registry with an accompanying website, this bill would require that a link be posted to that site instead.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 17 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a section 17-199.1 to read as follows:
      � 17-199.1 Marrow donor program. The department shall place on its website a link to the national marrow donor program website or, if such a website is established, to the New York state bone marrow donor program website.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 30 days after it becomes law.
